title: The Nintendo Switch has now outsold the PS4 in the US
author: Richard Lawler
content:
After Xbox Series X / S topped the US sales charts for game consoles in March based solely on how much money they brought in, things turned back to the usual during April, according to stats announced today by the NPD. The PS5 led April in dollar sales, aligning with what we saw as retailers seemed to have more of the consoles in stock last month than for most of 2022. It was followed by the Xbox platform and then Nintendo.

However the Switch did lead the month in unit sales, and the NPD says it has now passed Sony’s PlayStation 4 in terms of lifetime sales in the US, making it the fourth highest-selling console ever, behind the PS2, Xbox 360, and Wii.

The other notable hit continues to be Elden Ring, which sold enough games in April to hit No. 2 on the list behind Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga. Now Elden Ring is not only the best-selling game of 2022 (and home to gaming’s newest folk hero, Let me solo her) but it’s also the best-selling game over the last 12 months overall, taking a crown that is usually held by the most recent Call of Duty.

According to NPD analyst Mat Piscatella, industry spending is still well above usual pre-pandemic levels, however, data from Sensor Tower showed that the amount spent on mobile games dropped 10 percent from the same period in 2021.
description: Switch hits No. 4 all-time for console sales in the US.
